main event: A witness observed a bright, white light with an effect of seeming to move closer and closer, increasing in size and brightness constantly over a period of several seconds.
interesting points: The object was a bright, white light, without defined shape or edges, that gradually changed to a yellowish-white color.
The brightness was almost blinding at the peak before fading out and disappearing.
The witness initially thought it was a plane landing, but then realized it was not going down but appeared to be rising in the sky.
The apparent motion of the object was inconsistent with the behavior of a satellite.
The witness estimated the angular size of the object to be about 10 degrees.
sighted object: a bright, white light that increased in size and brightness
